TopicTitle: KSP 1.11 Hatches Obstructed but theres nothing blocking the hatch

Articles.Content:
so I just updated to KSP 1.11 and i was making a space station when i clicked the engineers report it says hatches obstructed and when i try to eva in the launchpad i cant get out of the cupola there was nothing blocking it can someone pls tell me why this is happening

Edited December 22, 2020 by Inker
Hmm... just tested it, can't confirm this. You have a craft file maybe?

Left click on module, transfer crew, EVA.

It is now issue with almost every vessel.

Read this BEFORE asking for support: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/

(copied from  @VoidSquid's signature for visibility.)

You need to help us help you. I've used many craft and have gone eva on most of them, and have not yet had a hatch obstructed in 1.11. So if you are having this problem you need to provide more information. The information listed in that linked thread.

If you got your game from steam, then it's important to understand that file corruption often happens during game updates. So after an update, if you see something odd happen that looks like a bug, the very first thing you should do is verify your file integrity from Steam. Have you?

evanrichter posted a report (link) on the bug tracker about nearby scanning arms blocking hatches.  It looks like, very roughly, all hatches within the scanning radius of the arm are counted as blocked.   [Edit: No, the hatches are not blocked.  The bug report found that if the first hatch of the pod is blocked, and if you click the EVA button on the Kerbal portrait, then you see the message "All hatches obstructed" but the 'all' is a lie; when there is a secondary hatch, by clicking on the hatch directly you get the EVA option and that succeeds.

That does not explain the problems with single-hatch parts like the cupola.  If anyone has a craft the shows the problem with a single-hatch part, putting that craft on bug report might help.] 

There was a note in the changelog  * Fix issue with certain airlock hatches not properly detecting obstructions. and a corresponding bug-report (link) about a  "maybe not worth fixing" inconsistency with hatches blocked by landing gear.

Edited December 27, 2020 by OHara
bug report was a false alarm
Interesting, thanks @OHara!

On 12/22/2020 at 10:22 AM, Inker said:

so I just updated to KSP 1.11 and i was making a space station when i clicked the engineers report it says hatches obstructed and when i try to eva in the launchpad i cant get out of the cupola there was nothing blocking it can someone pls tell me why this is happening

post pictures please. maybe the kerbonaut is in some other module which is actually blocked. maybe there is something blocking the cupola that is not evident. without seeing, we cannot know
